Now, here’s the lesson. When you are the one that gets get white people to be more racially equitable, those white people don’t embrace you & continue to work with you. They work to isolate and erase your work while they respond by propping up underfunded diversity programs.

@jewelmelanie’s win was a major win for Atlanta & the nation’s Black tech startup ecosystem. It took a real white ally to come to Atlanta to unlock capital to a Black founder. It sent a signal to Black founders to apply for funding; and to other pitch competitions to diversify.

@jewelmelanie was selected to pitch. She killed her pitch and was the front runner for the win. Yet, I was advised that @pauljudge was the lone judge holding out the final vote. Well, it “magically” worked itself out backstage & @Partpic was the winner of Atlanta’s @RiseOfRest!

We got @pauljudge added as a judge; and an extension on the application deadline so that @jewelmelanie @DreamMaven @candyvmitchell could apply. Then, I followed up with @RiseOfRest to make sure that they knew that Atlanta’s Black founders had submitted their apps to pitch.

So much behind the scenes education, lobbying & negotiation was done to get the Atlanta host team to be intentional about adding some racial equity. It is always a constant thing to get Atlanta’s white ecosysyem leaders to do anything that wasn’t performative & virtue signaling.

I met @stevecase via an intro from @MurielBowser at the DC House during @sxsw in 2015. I appealed to @revolution to make sure that Black founders & judges were equitably included. They listened; yet we had to navigate @ATLTechVillage’s push to center the event around themselves.

White ecosysyem builders, founders & BC’s never thought to visit @theohubs or ask to learn more until @SteveCase brought his @RiseOfRest to Atlanta. It’s like we were intentionally invisible to them. @rossbaird writes about it on @HuffPost,

We built the 1st & largest Black owned multicampus tech hub, coworking space & entrepreneurship center in the world. Mind you, my wife & I bootstrapped all of this. Yes, we were often referred to as the Black @WeWork, we were never able to raise any major capital to grow & scale.

Within 1 yr., we we had outgrown this space & preparing to launch 2 new campuses in West Midtown & on Westside w/ the late Herman J. Russell. @AtlBizChron wrote about it, https://www.bizjournals.com/atlanta/print-edition/2014/09/26/minority-startups-incubator-set-to-grow.html 15K mostly Black people would enter our doors to work, meetup, network, learn & hack

800 showed up in downtown Atlanta for the first @kingonomics conference. Over 2,000 showed up in DC. To continue the momentum, we birth our first campus of @theohubs in the historic old @Macys building in downtown Atlanta. It was here where we hosted @joeydigital’s @goodienation.

So I made a major sacrifice to consolidate our national @kingonomics book tour resources to create the first large scale Black tech, startup & venture conference in Atlanta & again in Washington DC during the 50th Anniversary of The March on Washington,

Having been the 1st Black founder to ever start a high growth tech company in the South & raise millions in venture & be acquired by a global @Nasdaq company, I know I had to do something to destroy the outlier affect in Atlanta’s ecosysyem & beyond,

So I drew strength from knowing that I encouraged and pushed @ABenton to go to Silicon Valley because I knew she could build an ecosystem there. She did it & the @NewMEBootcamp world was birthed & made #BlackTechTwitter a thing, specifically with the focus on startups & funding.

We were left no choice but to do this on our own. My wife & I would ideate deep into the night for months on what we should do, particularly because we had the with of the soon to be national release of @Kingonomics & the @ABCSharkTank platform at our disposal. The time was now!!

Truth be told, I met with the leadership of every major tech hub in the region, including @atdc between 2010-2012 asking them to add racial equity & fund authentic diversity, equity & inclusion programming. None of them moved but pointed to their 1 Black “unicorns”.
